subject: p16848073
History: Evaluation of the patient after esophagectomy and minimally invasive esophagogastrectomy with G-tube insertion.
Findings: PA and lateral upright chest radiographs were reviewed in comparison to. Blunting of the right costophrenic angle is unchanged and might be consistent with thickening of the pleura since no appreciable pleural effusion is demonstrated. Heart size and mediastinum are stable. Lungs are clear with improved aeration as compared to the prior study. There is no pneumothorax.
